name: 王正豪
objective:
This course is a graduate-level course for advanced big data analytics and applications. The major topics include: the concepts and principles of big data analytics, frameworks of distributed computing, and applications including: Link Analysis, Social Network Graph Mining, and Recommender Systems. The commonly used machine learning methods such as artificial neural networks and SVM will also be covered. 
In addition to conceptual introduction, with intensive programming exercises in parallel programming and term project, students are expected to learn the machine learning tools, and the program design of real big data applications.
schedule:
Part I: Big Data Analytics concepts & Distributed processing (7 wks)
1. Introduction to big data concepts (1 wk)
2. Introduction to distributed platforms: Hadoop & Spark  (1 wk)
3. MapReduce programming: pairs & stripes, relational algebra (1 wk)
4. More examples: matrix multiplication, similarity (1 wk)
5. Machine Learning Methods: NN, SVM (3 wks)

Midterm exam (1 wk)

Part II: Applications of Big Data Anlaytics (7 wks)
1. Finding Similar Items (1 wk)
2. Mining Data Streams (1 wk)
3. Link Analysis (1 wk)
4. Frequent Itemset (1 wk)
5. Recommendation Systems (1 wk)
6. Social Network Graph Mining (1 wk)
7. Others: Dimensionality Reduction (1 wk)


Term project presentation (3 wks)
scorePolicy:
Homework assignments and programming exercises: ~40%
Mid-term exam: ~25-30%
Term project and presentation: ~30-35%
